description: From German Mangold (“chard”) + Wurzel (“root”), with the first part reinterpreted as Mangel, whence the archaic English name "root of scarcity".

entries.meaning: A root vegetable, variety of Beta vulgaris, cultivated chiefly as cattle feed.
examples: Wheat and barley, oats and hay,Clover, beans, and mangel-wurzels
